channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
Suggestion to @twitter. I just got a warning about a tweet from July 7. I'd like to be able to see what it points to, but since the URL is obfuscated with the https://t.co/kE1rMbZQes domain, and there's no way to get to the offending tweet, I can't.

That doesn't seem right.

Here's a screen shot of the warning. https://t.co/XFfV1DSOoX
item.source:markdown:
Suggestion to @twitter. I just got a warning about a tweet from July 7. I'd like to be able to see what it points to, but since the URL is obfuscated with the https://t.co/kE1rMbZQes domain, and there's no way to get to the offending tweet, I can't.
That doesn't seem right.
Here's a screen shot of the warning. https://t.co/XFfV1DSOoX

item.description:
We got a message that an Electron app on Mac has "Nukespeed" adware in it. How can an Electron app be infected, and if it is what do you do about it?

https://t.co/F8EM63ZWi1

item.description:
The Mets broadcasters don’t bother calling the play by play or even telling us who’s at bat or pitching.

And the interviews are pure bullshit.

item.description: @moritz Thanks for clarifying. Items without titles are totally legit.
item.source:markdown: @moritz Thanks for clarifying. Items without titles are totally legit.

item.description:
@moritz @getkirby question -- do your posts have titles?

you can see how my new stuff will see your feed through this app.

https://t.co/6S6zuCLEvh

@moritz Fantastic.

I have subscribed to your feed in my new feed reader and it works. It's getting and using the markdown text.

Thanks for the interop! :-)

Are you using https://t.co/ZCRZ0ZXhUo to do this site? https://t.co/utYNnkfUBA
item.source:markdown:
@moritz Fantastic.
I have subscribed to your feed in my new feed reader and it works. It's getting and using the markdown text.
Thanks for the interop! :-)
Are you using https://t.co/ZCRZ0ZXhUo to do this site? https://t.co/utYNnkfUBA

item.description: @KnicksMuse Too distracting from all the other stuff that'll be going on. Let him go to the Nets. They need some help in the NY soul department. They hate NY, at least we know Melo fits in here.
item.source:markdown: @KnicksMuse Too distracting from all the other stuff that'll be going on. Let him go to the Nets. They need some help in the NY soul department. They hate NY, at least we know Melo fits in here.

item.description:
@moritz That's awesome!

You made my day.

Please send me the link.
@moritz My approach is a bit different. I strip all the markup, and say if you want to talk to me with paragraphs, links, styling, titles -- use Markdown.
item.source:markdown: @moritz My approach is a bit different. I strip all the markup, and say if you want to talk to me with paragraphs, links, styling, titles -- use Markdown.

item.description:
I would never try to reinvent twitter in terms of rss, but i do want very much to get the two networks joined.

twitter does what it does very well, and rss does something different, also very well.

the philosophy of the internet tells us we should get them to peer.
item.source:markdown:
I would never try to reinvent twitter in terms of rss, but i do want very much to get the two networks joined.
twitter does what it does very well, and rss does something different, also very well.
the philosophy of the internet tells us we should get them to peer.

item.description:
Heroku and Slack, both owned by Salesforce, both recently eliminated or cut back their free tier.

My two cents. OK with me. But tune up your pricing so it lets your product grow like a weed.

The tragedy of Heroku is that they made the product diseconomic for it's natural niche -- quick scripts that need to run on the net 24-by-7 but are very low bandwidth.
item.source:markdown:
Heroku and Slack, both owned by Salesforce, both recently eliminated or cut back their free tier.
My two cents. OK with me. But tune up your pricing so it lets your product grow like a weed.
The tragedy of Heroku is that they made the product diseconomic for it's natural niche -- quick scripts that need to run on the net 24-by-7 but are very low bandwidth.

item.description:
1/4 President Biden gave a speech about Maga Republicans. Interesting idea. It'll work if you start to hear pundits use the term. Intuitively -- I think the truth is there are no Maga Repubs. If anyone has voted with the Republican Party through the 2020 election, and there were

2/4 tens of millions of them, they are full of maganess. Muddying this up doesn't seem to serve any purpose other than calming Biden's supposed friendship with remaining fence-sitters such as Moscow Mitch. That's really who the term seems to be a gift to. Through the ongoing

3/4 Trump crime spree, he's still campaigning for the Republican candidates. The other term I don't like is "semi-fascist." Another dream -- somehow there are two kinds of fascists, ones who are on the way to being fascists and the real fascists. Again anyone who voted for Trump

4/4 in 2020 qualifies as 100 percent American grown Nazi-approved fascists, imho -- that is. 😀
item.source:markdown:
1/4 President Biden gave a speech about Maga Republicans. Interesting idea. It'll work if you start to hear pundits use the term. Intuitively -- I think the truth is there are no Maga Repubs. If anyone has voted with the Republican Party through the 2020 election, and there were
2/4 tens of millions of them, they are full of maganess. Muddying this up doesn't seem to serve any purpose other than calming Biden's supposed friendship with remaining fence-sitters such as Moscow Mitch. That's really who the term seems to be a gift to. Through the ongoing
3/4 Trump crime spree, he's still campaigning for the Republican candidates. The other term I don't like is "semi-fascist." Another dream -- somehow there are two kinds of fascists, ones who are on the way to being fascists and the real fascists. Again anyone who voted for Trump
4/4 in 2020 qualifies as 100 percent American grown Nazi-approved fascists, imho -- that is. 😀
